intro: Nauclea adina, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by spherical, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Nauclea adina is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested or savannah habitats. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native range.
